summary: pigs were bled at days 3, 7, 28, 56, 83, 113 and 125 after vaccination. IL-10, IL-8, IFN- (measured by ELISA tests of serum), TNF- and IFN- (measured by ELISA tests of serum), and serum neutralising antibodies were measured. the vaccine strain were first detected at day 56 in pigs vaccinated by both routes. a boost in NA was observed after challenge with a heterologous strain.
